reference.title: AMF support for N3IWF and non-3GPP access - phase 2 (Feature f20059-08): feature summary
reference.shortdesc: With this feature, the AMF supports CM-IDLE to CM-CONNECTED state transition for non-3GPP access, for example, through service request, paging or notification, as well as the possibility for the PDU switching from non-3GPP access to 3GPP access. This feature also modifies PCF handling and supports UE policy association for non-3GPP access.

table.title: AMF support for N3IWF and non-3GPP access - phase 2: feature summary

li.p: 3GPP TS 23.501: System Architecture for the 5G System; Stage 2 (Release 15), v15.11.0
3GPP TS 23.502: Procedures for the 5G System; Stage 2 (Release 15), v15.11.0
3GPP TS 24.501: Non-Access-Stratum (NAS) protocol for 5G System (5GS); Stage 3 (Release 15), v15.6.0
3GPP TS 29.413: Application of the NG Application protocol (NGAP) to non-3GPP access (Release 15), v15.5.0
3GPP TS 29.502: 5G System; Session Management Services, Stage 3 (Release 15), v15.9.0
3GPP TS 29.503: 5G System; Unified Data Management Services, Stage 3 (Release 15), v15.8.0
3GPP TS 29.510: 5G System; Network Function Repository Services, Stage 3 (Release 15), v15.8.0
3GPP TS 29.518: 5G System; Access and Mobility Management Services, Stage 3 (Release 15), v15.8.0
3GPP TS 29.531: 5G System; Network Slice Selection Services; Stage 3 (Release 15), v15.5.0
3GPP TS 29.540: 5G System; SMS Services, Stage 3 (Release 15), v15.7.0
3GPP TS 29.571: 5G System; Common Data Types for Service Based Interfaces; Stage 3 (Release 15), v15.6.0
3GPP TS 33.501: Security architecture and procedures for 5G System (Release 15), v15.10.0
3GPP TS 38.413: NG-RAN; NG Application Protocol (NGAP) (Release 15), v15.6.0 + R3-204166

entry.note: NGAP version is December 2019 due to interaction with gNB.

entry.ph: AMF support for N3IWF and non-3GPP access - phase 1 (Feature f20059-09)

entry.p: In this phase, paging/notification is considered only triggered by messaging from the SMF. Other triggers from mobility/subscription/SMS are not considered.
In this phase, if a UE is already registered on an access (for example, 3GPP) from a serving PLMN, the registration on another access (for example, non-3GPP) from another serving PLMN is rejected.
Command amfGParms, parameters contactOverNon3gppFor3gpp, n3gppInitialCtxtNas, and pageOn3gppIfNon3gppFail
